com.nexmo.sdk.verify.event

Enum Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Command>
      • com.nexmo.sdk.verify.event.Command
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Command>

    public enum Command
extends java.lang.Enum<Command>
    Available commands for controlling the verification workflow, in order to further tailor your end-user experience.

    You should only consider implementing this API if there is a strong need to change the verification process while it is underway, due to user-detected issues. In some cases, end-users may wish to manually invoke a retry - something to the effect of "Send me my code again". Normally Verify manages retry timing by automatically determining if it needs to attempt delivering the code once again. This retry is invoked if a check is not received within the average expected duration for completing a verification successfully.

    The available commands are:

    • LOGOUT Once a user is in UserStatus.USER_VERIFIED state a Logout command can be performed.
    • CANCEL Using command 'Cancel', an outstanding request may be cancelled and a new one issued. This approach, helps you to trigger the same channel as the first attempt, since it initiates the Verification flow all over again. This mimics the traditional "Retry" or "Correct my number" button, where a user initiates Verify for the same or a new number because something went wrong.
    • TRIGGER_NEXT_EVENT Using the command 'trigger_next_event', Verify can be instructed to failover immediately, instead of waiting for the default duration. This will trigger the next attempt to deliver the verification code, typically over Text to Speech. A relatable way to think of this is a "Did not receive your SMS?" or "Call me instead" button; which may be made actionable if you determine that the phone number should have good cellular connectivity.

    To issue a verify command call VerifyClient.command(String, String, Command, CommandListener) The CommandListener in place is responsible for event notifications.

    Note that trying to deliver the PIN code again in a shorter duration does not necessarily translate into better conversion, it also doesn't result in a good user experience owing to the fact that users take time to complete the verification process.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      CANCEL
      Once a user is in UserStatus.USER_PENDING state, and the verification flow is started for more than 30 seconds, it can be cancelled.
      LOGOUT
      Once a user is in UserStatus.USER_VERIFIED state, he can be un-verified using this command.
      TRIGGER_NEXT_EVENT
      Once a user is in UserStatus.USER_PENDING state, verify can be instructed to trigger the next attempt to deliver the verification code, typically over Text To Speech.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • LOGOUT

        public static final Command LOGOUT
        Once a user is in UserStatus.USER_VERIFIED state, he can be un-verified using this command. However, if the user is not verified before performing this action, a VerifyError.INVALID_USER_STATUS_FOR_COMMAND error will be triggered.

      • CANCEL

        public static final Command CANCEL
        Once a user is in UserStatus.USER_PENDING state, and the verification flow is started for more than 30 seconds, it can be cancelled. If the verification flow was initiated less than 30 seconds later, a VerifyError.COMMAND_NOT_SUPPORTED error will be triggered. However, if the user is not in pending state before performing this action, a VerifyError.INVALID_USER_STATUS_FOR_COMMAND error will be triggered.

      • TRIGGER_NEXT_EVENT

        public static final Command TRIGGER_NEXT_EVENT
        Once a user is in UserStatus.USER_PENDING state, verify can be instructed to trigger the next attempt to deliver the verification code, typically over Text To Speech. However, if the user is not in UserStatus.USER_PENDING state before performing this action, a VerifyError.INVALID_USER_STATUS_FOR_COMMAND error will be triggered.
